Hamilton firefighter celebrates 25 years of servicehttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/firefighting-a-family-affair/5T55SINR7FD47FX5GNSICQM5VY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/firefighting-a-family-affair/5T55SINR7FD47FX5GNSICQM5VY/ Dean TaylorCareer Gold Star firefighter following in the footsteps of his father and grandfather. Wed, 22 Nov 2023 02:03:00 +0000 Station officer Andrew Bailey, a career firefighter for the Hamilton Fire Brigade, based at Te Rapa Station, and a Gold Star recipient for 25 years of service, outside Te Awamutu Fire Station, where he started his firefighting career as a volunteer in 1997. He is holding the Te Awamutu Volunteer Fire Brigade's photos of his grandfather E. J. (Bob) Quinlan (left) and father Ray Bailey. Both were also Gold Star recipients and honorary life members of the station, and Bob was awarded the Queen's Fire Service Medal in 1973. Photo / Dean Taylor
